reviews.text: We were booked for 2 nights at this hotel. We had booked 4 rooms, 2 Superior Deluxe and 2 Deluxe but quite frankly, the "Luxe" factor was nowhere to be felt. From the moment we stepped inside the hotel, the feel was very creepy. When we check-in to our rooms, ALAS!! Where did we land up!! Though I had seen the room pics put up by a few reviewers, I was hopeful that reality could be better but I guessed it wrong.
reviews.title: Where the hell did we land up!!!!!

reviews.text: The biggest joke was when I went down to reception to express my unhappiness about decor, the guy at reception laughed at me stating that the hotel was refurbished just last year! I wonder how bad it was before refurbishment, if this is what it is now. This is a typical case of approach to hospitality, a la Govt.style as this is a State Govt. enterprise.
reviews.title: Super location - recommended to anyone

reviews.text: Food quality from Room Service was acceptable as we were too tired to walk down to main street late evening and to add to it the disappointment due to room quality.
reviews.title: Safe bet in Macleodganj!!!

reviews.text: The following morning, I hopped across to an adjoining property - Chinar House and requested the person at reception to show mean empty room. The room was a lot more spacious and open but they did not have 4 rooms available so I put off the idea of shifting out of Bhagsu (despite having prepaid).
reviews.title: Excellent location, everything else average

reviews.text: As there was nothing much to do in Dharamshala / McLeodganj, coming back again is ruled out but I would certainly not recommend this hotel to anyone with a superior taste to consider staying here. I am quite sure, Chinar Lodge could be a bit better.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Located at a very central location, just in the heart of Mcleodganj, this place is very very well connected to the market, bus stand and everywhere else you may want to go in McLeodgunj. Despite the connectivity, it is beautifully calm. Like any typical HPTDC hotel, the food variety is limited yet tasty. Rooms are basic but clean. Biggest advantage is the big open area surrounding the hotel. Overall a very good, nice place to stay in Mcleod.
reviews.title: Good deal!

reviews.text: We visited Mcleod Ganj on June 4-6 with family of 6. We had booked Bhagsu Suite and Double Room Deluxe. The suite is overrated with sitting area beyond the bed room which is strange. It is close to garden with good views of icy peaks but smells of food of Kitchen. The Deluxe rooms also have good views but are road facing. At night one needs to close windows else you get disturbed by barking dogs. The Hotel is slightly old but is very strategically placed.
reviews.title: Neat Hotel in Mcleodganj

reviews.text: Good points : Comfortable rooms. However carpets need change. Water ran out 3 times in 2 days but promptly came back on calling reception. Good grounds within Hotel own parking rare in Mcleod, very courteous staff. Restaurant Lunch service is better then dinner as staff wants to close dinner by 11.00 PM so want to take last order before 10.00 which seems very early.
reviews.title: Nice Place to stay

reviews.text: Other Restaurants, Dalai Lama Temple and market are close by walking distance,
reviews.title: The Best in Mcleodganj

reviews.text: Nice place & excellent location at Macleodganj. The hotel is well kept. I stayed in 1988 Previously.It has the same old charm.Its a Value for money Pack.
reviews.title: Second trip to Mcleodganj in May 2012

reviews.text: This place is well located and if you get a Delux room, you'll get a lovely view of the mountains. The Super Deluxe rooms are larger, but face the garden at the back. Pleasant terrace for breakfast at the back, but the restaurant food is nothing special. The staff were very friendly and helpful and always greeted us with a smile. Seems as if most clientele are Indians, only saw one other lot of foreigners here..... but everyone smiles and helps. Bathrooms are OK, if a little outdated. Plenty of hot water once you figure out which tap to turn when. Rooms are a bit dowdy but OK. Old carpets could do with being replaced.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, pleasant gardens

reviews.text: We stayed in The Bhagsu from 15-Apr-12 to 17-Apr-12 while our trip to Dharamshala and Mcleodgunj. The hotel is located in Mcleodganj (upper Dharamshala). We booked one Super Delux and one Delux room. The booking was done from HPTDC office in Kolkata. The rooms (specially the Super Delux) are large, well decorated and maintained. The toilets are clean. The food Quality is very good. The hotel staffs are very much co-operative. And the surroundings are quite impressive. The Dalai Lama Temple and Bhagsunag Temple are located within 15 mins by car. The market place is within 5 mins (walking distance). Our overall experience is very good. Shall recommend others to book in advance (specially the Super Delux rooms).
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is nice and clean....though the property is little old but staff is very helpful, they arranged tour for us to the buddhist temples and palampur...food was nice and a good change if you have had enough of sampling italian and tibetan food.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is an old gem...We really enjoyed our stay and especially the Himachali Food.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: The room service and preparation was awesome. The Hotel rooms are pretty spacious (depending on the category)..The main market is walking distance and Dalai Lama's Temple was not far off. I would recommend this place to all travelers who are looking for best quality with a economic stay !
reviews.title: Nice people, beautiful location and a complete value for money.

reviews.text: Its located in Mcleodganj in the upper Dharamshala in a quite surroundings though near Main market road and close to Dalai Lama temple complex. Its a decent hotel run by HPTDC, better compared to some of the HPTDC hotels in have stayed before...Staff is good and cooperative. Food is good but Mcleodganj is a great place for foodies lots of nice restaurants,cafes and small eating joints nearby.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: Location of the hotel is good, it is very quiet but only few rooms have view. Rooms were not good bed was very hard, water was leaking from roof in rain, fan was noisy. Bad service as the hotel is a government undertaking, hence every employee behaves like a govt. employee. If you want to ruin your vacation, try and talk to the person at reception. the only thing i like about this hotel was the food, i think it was the best served in the whole Mcleodganj.
reviews.title: Good location, good food, bad service and bad rooms.

reviews.text: The hotel is very well located, just close to Dalai Lama's Temple. The rooms are neat and well kept. The rates offered are quite competitive and offer good value for money. Planning to stay here, you must look at staying at the Bhagsu suite. Priced at 2800 it offers a very spacious room with a separate seating room and a spacious rest room equipped with a bathing tub, though not in the best of shape. Food is also simple and delicious.
reviews.title: Pure Valu for Money

reviews.text: Hotel Bhagsu has a very convenient location i.e. in the hub of the main market in Mcleodganj. Also, they have their own parking space (which is a boon if you've travelled by road). It is otherwise impossible to find a parking spot in the narrow streets of Mcleodganj.
reviews.title: Good location, very prompt service

reviews.text: There is lot of open scenic space in the hotel property, so if you are with kids: they would love the area. The rooms and bathrooms are neat and clean.
reviews.title: Good location, pleasant stay
